snippets: Australia slightly ahead of England after frenetic opening day in which both teams were bowled out cheaply at the MCG.
England's Ashes tour teeters on another crisis as they are bowled out for 110 on an almost farcical first day of the fourth Test at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.

England put in another disappointing batting display by failing to chase down Australia's opening tally of 152, as day one of the fourth Ashes Test closes with the home side leading by 46 runs in Melbourne.

summary: On the first day of the fourth Ashes Test at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, both Australia and England were bowled out cheaply, with Australia scoring 152 and England 110. Australia ended the day at 4-0 in their second innings, leading by 46 runs. The pitch favored bowlers, resulting in 20 wickets falling in a single day before a record Boxing Day crowd of 94,199.
